byline.contributor: Matt Higgins reported from Buffalo, and Katie Rogers from New York. Daniel Victor contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MATT HIGGINS and KATIE ROGERS

abstract: Erie County District Attorney Frank A Sedita III says during news conference that mother of woman accusing Chicago Blackhawks forward Patrick Kane of rape lied when she charged that there had been evidence tampering in case; accuser's lawyer Thomas Eoannou abruptly resigns; investigation into rape allegations will continue.
lead_paragraph: Thomas Eoannou withdrew his representation of the woman who accused the Blackhawks star of rape, saying his ethical obligations mean he can “no longer represent my client effectively.”

headline.main: Tampering Claim in Case Against Patrick Kane Is Called a Hoax
headline.print_headline: Tampering Claim in Assault Case Is Called a Hoax

snippet: Thomas Eoannou withdrew his representation of the woman who accused the Blackhawks star of rape, saying his ethical obligations mean he can “no longer represent my client effectively.”
